meanings.sent1: Every morning, the sunrise transpires in the east.
meanings.sent2: It transpires that the meeting will take place tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The race transpires at noon, so don't be late!
meanings.sent4: As the day unfolds, what transpires is a beautiful story of nature.
meanings.sent5: In the forest, the magic of life transpires with each rustle of leaves.

meanings.definition: To become known or be revealed
meanings.sent2: It transpires that she was the one who planned the surprise party.
meanings.sent3: The secret plan transpires when the cake arrives early.
meanings.sent4: In the end, what transpires is the power of honesty and trust.
meanings.sent5: In the movie plot, the villain's evil plan transpires in a dramatic twist.
